It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Special Collections Librarian, Hoskins Library, University of Tennessee, 1401 Cumberland Avenue, Knoxville, TN 37996. (865) 974-4480.

bibl.title: [Spoliation Claim] 1838 Sep. 18, Coosawattee District, The United States to Ratting Gourd / Collins McDonald
bibl.author: McDonald, Collins
bibl.note: This document is a Spoliation claim made September 18,1838, and signed by Collins McDonald, agent to the Cherokee Indians. The claim was for Ratting Gourd of the Coosawatee District. It lists his property, and its worth, that he lost due to the removal of the Cherokee Indians by the United States government.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div1.opener:
The United States for Spoliation Dr
To Ratting Gourd of Coosoowattee District
since 23rd May 1838

row.cell: Two head of Horses 1 Black filly 1 Bay mare
Nine pots from the largest sise down the small
Three pair cards 1 at 2.00 & 1 at 1.50 & 1 at 1.00
Two Feather beds one at 12. and the other at 8.
One set of Knives and forks
One six acre field of corn, also a large bean patch, one acre in potatoes, also a patch of Irish Potatos a quantity of Turnip left for seed one large onion patch
A large patch of fine cabbage

div1.p: This applican affirms that he was forced by the authority of the United States to abandon the above named property and that it is worth the prices annexd according to the best of his knowedge and belief affirmed to before me this 18th of Sept. 1838
div1.closer:
Collins McDonald
Agent C.C. East RattingHis x markGourd Tobaco plant&Cah.soo.to.ty
Came before me and solemnly affirms that the above account against the United States is just and true and that he was forced to abandon sd property by the authority of the United States according to the best of their knowledge and belief affirmed to before me this 18th of Sept. 1838Collins McDonald
Agent C.C. East Tobaco his x mark Plant
Cah.soo lan.ty his x mark
Spoliation
Ratting Gourd
Coosoowattee Dist
